html.p: The library is straightforward to use. To set up, you need to do two things:

ul.li: Upload python_lib.zip as a static asset (Warning: if you are already using a custom python grading library, then you will need to combine the two!)

html.p: To use in a problem, create an advanced problem, and enter the following to see if things are working:
html.pre:
<problem> <script type="text/python" system_path="python_lib"> from mitxgraders import * grader = StringGrader( answers='cat' ) </script>
<customresponse cfn="grader"> <textline correct_answer="cat"/> </customresponse> </problem>
html.p: Very similar to the Studio usage above. To set up:

ul.li: Put python_lib.zip in your static folder (Warning: if you are already using a custom python grading library, then you will need to combine the two!)

html.p: To use, create a problem, and use the above code to test it out.
